p: The 2002–2003 SARS pandemic was caused by a coronavirus that emerged from bats (first reservoir) [ 25] to infect palm civets (intermediary reservoir) and then humans [ 215]. A total of 8096 probable cases were reported and almost 10% (774 cases in more than 30 countries) of these resulted in death [ 216, 217, 218]. The clinical portrait was described as an initial flu-like syndrome, followed by a respiratory syndrome associated with cough and dyspnea, complicated with the “real” severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in about 20% of the patients [ 31, 219]. In addition, multiple organ failure was observed in several SARS-CoV-infected patients [ 220].
